column4: Can I uninstall the Ubuntu desktop pack with - apt-get remove ubuntu-desktop?
no.  that only uninstalls the meta package itself
Ok so how do I go back to pure Xubuntu?
You have to uninstall it all manually.  Unless you installed u-d with aptitude, or you can use deborphan
Ok so if I install Ubuntu Desktop with aptitude I can remove it?
yeah, and it'll remove all the dependencies you added with it
asinine about telling him to google for a package
There is packages for Assembly compilers? - well then I stand corrected.
kubuntu uses adept package manager, not synaptic.
I don't see how it's uncool.  But, sure.
What error/message/whatever does it give you?
none. It simply hangs when loading the xserver.
ctrl-alt-f1, f2, f3, f4, f5, f6 (that's ctrl-alt-f#) can all be used simultaneously
As a stop gap, of course.  I wouldn't actually consider doing that for prolonged periods ;)
